Staff are working remotely, and will respond to email.  Please send any questions to your advisor or to hcollege@uic.edu.   COVID-19 Updates and Resources         Breadcrumbs   Honors College    Academics    Graduation Preparation        Graduation Preparation       Convocation Information      We are deeply saddened to announce that the Honors College Convocation 2020 has been cancelled due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.Â  Please watch this page for additional information about how the Honors College plans to recognize the accomplishments of the Class of 2020.  The Honors College Convocation is a formal and personal way to acknowledge the success of graduating seniors each spring semester. At the ceremony, students wear their commencement robes, and receive their gold stoles and a certificate of achievement. A leading scholar and an Honors College graduating senior are asked to speak.  The Honors College honors graduating seniors each fall semester through a reception, where they receive their gold stoles and a certificate of achievement, alongside their families and Honors College staff and Faculty Fellows.  Find more information here .       Declare your Intent to Graduate with the Honors College   The link to declare your intent to graduate with the Honors College will be posted here  each semester, for students planning to graduate at the end of that semester.       UIC Graduation Details   Please find information about how to declare your intent to graduate with your degree-granting college, conferral dates, and diploma processes here .
